OK, actually I wrote a couple of lua programs to figure this out.

First, I=
 ran the network that we've been discussing and I understand 
that the (1+2=
)=3D2 was a type-o, because h1 always remains at 1 so the 
network will sta=
blize under these conditions.

Then, I created a new network which better i=
llustrates the point I 
was trying to make:

Take four nodes, I, h0, h1, O.=


Links:
I -> h0
h0 -> h1
h1 -> h0
h1 -> O

Resulting formula:
i=3D1
h0 =3D=
 i + h1
h1 =3D i + h0
O =3D h1


I ran this lua code:

i=3D1
h0=3D0
h1=3D0
=
O=3D0

for a=3D1,20,1 do
	i=3D1
	h0 =3D i + h1
	h1 =3D i + h0
	O =3D h1
	pr=
int(i,h0,h1,O)
end


and this is what I got:

> dofile("test.lua")
